headline: Moderna Surges; Covid Vaccine Sales Decline, But Top Expectations
summary: Moderna stock surged Thursday. Though third-quarter vaccine sales declined, they came in above expectations.

content.title: Moderna Surges; Covid Vaccine Sales Decline, But Top Expectations
content.summary: Moderna stock surged Thursday. Though third-quarter vaccine sales declined, they came in above expectations.

headline: Moderna Gains on Sharp Cost Cuts as Covid Vaccine Declines
summary: The company posted a net loss of 51 cents a share, against Wall Street’s expectation for a loss of $2.21.  Moderna has aggressively reduced costs through measures including staff cuts and lower spending on research and manufacturing to offset slowing vaccine sales.  The company still has a goal of breaking even by 2028, Moderna Chief Financial Officer Jamey Mock said in an interview.

content.title: Moderna Gains on Sharp Cost Cuts as Covid Vaccine Declines
content.summary: The company posted a net loss of 51 cents a share, against Wall Street’s expectation for a loss of $2.21.  Moderna has aggressively reduced costs through measures including staff cuts and lower spending on research and manufacturing to offset slowing vaccine sales.  The company still has a goal of breaking even by 2028, Moderna Chief Financial Officer Jamey Mock said in an interview.

headline: Moderna (NASDAQ:MRNA) Posts Better-Than-Expected Sales In Q3, Stock Soars
summary: Biotechnology company Moderna (NASDAQ:MRNA) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, but sales fell by 45.4% year on year to $1.02 billion. On the other hand, the company’s full-year revenue guidance of $1.8 billion at the midpoint came in 4.4% below analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP loss of $0.51 per share was 78.6% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Moderna (NASDAQ:MRNA) Posts Better-Than-Expected Sales In Q3, Stock Soars
content.summary: Biotechnology company Moderna (NASDAQ:MRNA) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025, but sales fell by 45.4% year on year to $1.02 billion. Its GAAP loss of $0.51 per share was 78.6% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Moderna revenue falls 45%, but still tops estimates
summary: Investing.com - Moderna has reported a sharp drop in third-quarter revenue, but still topped Bloomberg consensus estimates, while the drugmaker also trimmed its full-year sales forecast.

content.title: Moderna revenue falls 45%, but still tops estimates
content.summary: Investing.com - Moderna has reported a sharp drop in third-quarter revenue, but still topped Bloomberg consensus estimates, while the drugmaker also trimmed its full-year sales forecast.

headline: Moderna Swings to a Loss. The Stock Jumps Anyway.
summary: Shares of  Moderna  rose sharply Thursday after the vaccine company reported better-than-expected quarterly results and narrowed its full-year guidance.  Moderna  posted a loss of 51 cents a share for the third quarter, down from a profit of 3 cents last year, but narrower than analysts’ consensus calls for a loss of $2.12.  The company also said it now expects 2025 revenue of $1.6 billion to $2 billion, compared to a previous range of $1.5 billion to $2.2 billion.

content.title: Moderna Swings to a Loss. The Stock Jumps Anyway.

Moderna  posted a loss of 51 cents a share for the third quarter, down from a profit of 3 cents last year, but narrower than analysts’ consensus calls for a loss of $2.12.  The company also said it now expects 2025 revenue of $1.6 billion to $2 billion, compared to a previous range of $1.5 billion to $2.2 billion.

headline: Moderna Posts Narrower Loss, Cost Cuts Boost Shares
summary: Moderna shares rose after the company posted a narrower third-quarter loss than Wall Street expected, a sign that its cost-cutting measures are helping offset the decline of its Covid business. Gerry Smith reports on "Bloomberg Open Interest."

content.title: Moderna Posts Narrower Loss, Cost Cuts Boost Shares

headline: Moderna’s Quarter Wasn’t As Bad as It Could Have Been. The Stock Is Up.
summary: Moderna’s  third-quarter results weren’t as bad as they could have been, which was enough to trigger a rally in the stock on Thursday.  Sales of Moderna’s respiratory syncytial virus, or RSV, vaccine remain negligible, and the company had a net loss of $200 million for the quarter.  The quarter’s revenue of $1 billion beat the  FactSet  consensus estimate of $900 million.

content.title: Moderna’s Quarter Wasn’t As Bad as It Could Have Been. The Stock Is Up.
content.summary: Moderna’s  third-quarter results weren’t as bad as they could have been, which was enough to trigger a rally in the stock on Thursday.  Sales of Moderna’s respiratory syncytial virus, or RSV, vaccine remain negligible, and the company had a net loss of $200 million for the quarter.  The quarter’s revenue of $1 billion beat the  FactSet  consensus estimate of $900 million.

headline: Moderna leans on cost cuts, pipeline as vaccine sales dip
summary: Despite quarterly revenue totals that were nearly cut in half compared to the same period last year, Moderna still expects to break even financially in 2028 with the help of more disciplined spending.

content.title: Moderna leans on cost cuts, pipeline as vaccine sales dip
content.summary: Despite quarterly revenue totals that were nearly cut in half compared to the same period last year, Moderna still expects to break even financially in 2028 with the help of more disciplined spending.
